newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Paranagua soybean exports already top 1996.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Paranagua soybean exports already top 1996.

text.p: Soybean shipments so far this year from Brazil's key grains port of Paranagua have already exceeded total exports in 1996, said a port authority spokeswoman.
To May 7, the port has shipped 2.01 million tonnes of soybeans against 923,351 tonnes in the same period last year and total 1996 soybean exports of 1.95 million tonnes.

April shipments were 899,245 tonnes against 575,292 tonnes in the same month last year and exports in the first seven days of May were 300,708 tonnes against 74,571 in the corresponding period in 1996.
Soymeal exports were however running below last year at 1.77 million tonnes against 2.02 million tonnes to May 7, 1996.
In April, soymeal exports reached 741,889 tonnes against 564,893 tonnes in April 1996 while in the first seven days of May, exports were 124,293 tonnes against 174,731 tonnes in May 1-7, 1996.
Total soymeal shipments in 1996 were 6.68 million tonnes.

Brazilian soybean exports from this year's crop are expected to reach a record eight million tonnes after the removal of an export tax which favored the export of soymeal and soyoil. ((-Caroline Bulloch, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 5074151))
